alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 1:28PM EDT until July 09 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Washington County in north central Maryland... Western Frederick County in north central Maryland... East central Jefferson County in the Panhandle of West Virginia... * Until 215 PM EDT. * At 128 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Saint James to near Harpers Ferry, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Robinwood, Brunswick, Boonsboro, Smithsburg, Braddock Heights, Mount Aetna, Mount Lena, San Mar, Harpers Ferry, Wolfsville, Saint James, Adamstown, Jefferson, Myersville, Cavetown, Keedysville, Sharpsburg, Fairplay, Sabillasville and Rosemont. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
